info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN BEDFORD...NORTHEASTERN SOMERSET...SOUTHERN BLAIR AND SOUTHWESTERN CAMBRIA COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EDT... At 1245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Portage to near Windber to 12 miles southeast of Belmont. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Portage and Blue Knob State Park around 1255 PM EDT. Queen, Lilly and Ski Gap around 100 PM EDT. Bedford, St. Clairsville and Osterburg around 105 PM EDT. New Enterprise around 110 PM EDT. Hollidaysburg, Duncansville and Martinsburg around 115 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Tunnelhill, Spring Hill, Cassandra, Hopewell and New Paris. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
